item.title: Interview with Brian Beckman of Amazon
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 19 of the Modern Agile Show features an interview with Brian Beckman, physicist and principal engineer in robotics at Amazon. Brian met Richard Feynman when he was a child and teenager and became greatly inspired by him. Brian tells a marvelous story that illustrates how serious Amazon is about investing in “customer obsession” and how the company embraces experimentation to discover faster, safer and cheaper ways to serve customers. He explains the necessity of Amazon’s drone delivery service, how it won’t be deployed until it’s safe, as well as why and when Amazon transitioned to microservices. Finally, Brian answers my question, “are people psychologically safe at Amazon?"

item.title: Interview with Jennifer Marsman, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 18 of the Modern Agile Show features an interview with Jennifer Marsman, an expert in machine learning and artificial intelligence and a principal software development engineer at Microsoft. Jennifer spoke at YOW! 2017 about her experiment to use machine learning to analyze brain wave data to determine if people were telling the truth. She explains how supervised machine learning and deep learning via neural networks are helping make people awesome. Finally, she explains how Microsoft’s culture is changing, including how they are encouraging people to conduct experiments and have a growth mindset.

item.title: Interview with Dave Farley, Co-Author of Continuous Delivery
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 17 of the Modern Agile Show features an interview with Dave Farley, co-author of Continuous Delivery. an independent software programmer and consultant and YOW! 2017 keynote speaker. Dave believes in applying the scientific method to software development and sees Continuous Delivery as a platform for experimentation. He believes that the biggest impact you can have in a software team is to get members of the team sitting next to people using the software and learning from what they observe. He explains how Continuous Compliance flows out of Continuous Delivery to provide rich, valuable audits trails for auditors.Finally, Dave tells us about how he Makes Safety A Prerequisite via "unconditional positive regard” (a concept he learned from his wife, Katherine) and how he creates high-trust team environments.

item.title: Interview with Lynn Langit
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 16 of the Modern Agile Show features an interview with Lynn Langit, a cloud architect, data architect, coder, instructor, autodidact and keynote speaker. Lynn entered the field of software at age 38, she is the author of a best-selling Hadoop course on Linda.com, she taught her calculus at age 51 in order to learn Machine Learning, she teaches kids how to program and she’s been helping scientists create high performance, cloud-based Genomic editing software.

item.title: Interview with Jeff Patton at YOW! 2017
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 15 of the Modern Agile Show features an interview with Jeff Patton, veteran agilest, author of the best-selling book, User Story Mapping and the guy who teaches the fantastic workshop, Passionate Product Leadership.

item.title: Interview with David J Bland, Founder and CEO, Precoil
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 14 of the Modern Agile Show features an interview with David J Bland, CEO and Founder of Precoil. We discuss optimizing for learning, how your customer determines what is viable in an MVP, how David helps companies experiment and learn rapidly and safely and what is assumption mapping.

item.title: Interview with Melissa Perri and Matt Barcomb: Issues with Product Owner role
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 13 of the Modern Agile Show features an interview with Melissa Perri and Matt Barcomb. We discuss issues with the Product Owner role, as defined by Scrum and explore the importance of product management and how to make product ownership a team sport.

item.title: Interview with Laura Klein, author of Build Better Products
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 12 of the Modern Agile Show features an interview with Lean Startup/UX guru, Laura Klein, author of Build Better Products: A Modern Approach to Building Successful User-Centered Products. Learn how her work maps to Modern Agile, User Maps and how Laura writes books on a treadmill!

item.title: Interview with Brett Durrett CEO of IMVU
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 11 of the Modern Agile Show features an interview with the great Brett Durrett, CEO of the Silicon Valley company, IMVU. He talks about the Modern Agile principles present at IMVU and how the company grew from nothing to $50 million/year in revenue.

item.title: The Tar Pit Agile Leadership interview with David Lokietz
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 10 of the Modern Agile Show begins with a small passage from The Mythical Man-Month, by Frederick P. Brooks, Jr, followed by an interview about agile leadership with agile coach, David Lokietz.

item.title: Cycles of Mistrust explained
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 9 of the Modern Agile Show is about the Cycle of Mistrust, as documented in the fantastic book, Driving Fear out of the Workplace, by Kathleen D. Ryan and Daniel K. Oestreich.

item.title: Bargain Hunting Lean Startup Story Industrial Logic Story
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 8 of the Modern Agile Show is about the valuable practice of bargain hunting. You’ll hear bargain hunting stories about plumbing, a teleportation feature in IMVU (the birthplace of Lean Startup) and a security feature in Industrial Logic’s eLearning.

item.title: Jez Humble Interview Lean Enterprise Trunk Based Development
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode 7 of the Modern Agile Show features an interview with Jez Humble, co-author of Continuous Delivery, Lean Enterprise and The DevOps Handbook. Jez reads a passage from Lean Enterprise, we discuss the Modern Agile principles, Continuous Delivery and Trunk-based development.

item.title: Make People Awesome Horizontally Hobbled Pixar Collaboration Story Badass Ex
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: A show about Making People Awesome, Horizontally Hobbled teams, the designer table that caused collaboration issues at Pixar, Kathy Sierra's Badass book and what it teaches us.

item.title: Vision + Hustle What Product Leaders Do My Product Story Q+A
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: You need Vision and Hustle to be awesome at implementing Modern Agile, a passage about Product Leaders from the book, The Discipline of Market Leaders, a story about Industrial Logic's product at a famous search engine company and answering a question about deadlines.

item.title: Deliver Value Continuously Demystified Lean Startup Continuous Deployment Q+A.
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: A show devoted to the topic of Delivering Value Continuously, a passage about Continuous Deployment from the book, The Lean Startup (by Eric Ries) and several answers to questions about Delivering Value Continuously.

item.title: Networks Not Hierarchies Who Sets Team Priorities Hardest Principle to Adopt
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: A book passage from Tom DeMarco about teams as Networks not Hierarchies, a white board discussion about who sets priorities on teams, answering a question about the hardest Modern Agile principle to adopt.

item.title: Thomas Edison Story Feature Fake Is MA Old or New
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Story of an early failure by Thomas Edison and what he learned from it. Explanation of a Feature Fake and how it helps you remain capital efficient and avoid building features that not enough people need. Answering a question about whether Modern Agile is back to basics or modern?

item.title: Show Intro Four Principles Tom DeMarco Story
item.itunes:author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.author: Joshua Kerievsky
item.description: Episode #1 Why Modern Agile? A brief guide to Modern Agile's four principles. Who is Joshua Kerievsky? A "Make People Awesome" story from Tom DeMarco's classic book, Slack.
